skill.name: schema-visualizer
skill.description: Generate database schema diagrams, ERDs, and documentation from database schemas.
skill.summary: Generate database schema diagrams, ERDs, and documentation from database schemas.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, no network access, no filesystem access, and no external command execution. Contains only AI instructions for database schema visualization.

content.user_title: Generate database schema diagrams and ERDs
content.value_statement: Understanding complex database schemas takes time and can lead to mistakes. This skill helps you generate professional ERDs, Mermaid diagrams, and documentation from any database schema source instantly.
actual_capabilities: Generate Mermaid ERD diagrams from database schemas
Parse Prisma, TypeORM, and SQLAlchemy models
Create schema documentation in Markdown, JSON, and YAML formats
Suggest missing indexes and normalization improvements
Export diagrams for PlantUML and dbdiagram.io
limitations: Does not connect to live databases directly
Cannot execute queries or modify database data
Visualization quality depends on schema information provided
Cannot generate diagrams from binary database files

use_cases.title: Document existing databases
use_cases.description: Generate complete documentation for legacy databases to onboard new team members quickly.

use_cases.title: Design and share schemas
use_cases.description: Create clear ERDs from ORM models to communicate database designs with stakeholders.

use_cases.title: Create schema documentation
use_cases.description: Produce readable database documentation in Markdown or JSON format for technical docs.

output: Users table with columns: id (int, PK), email (varchar, unique), username (varchar, unique)
Orders table linked to Users via user_id foreign key
Products table with category_id referencing Categories
Order_Items junction table connecting Orders and Products
Visual ERD showing one-to-many relationships between entities

best_practices: Provide complete schema information for accurate relationship detection
Use --include-indexes flag to show performance considerations in diagrams
Export to multiple formats to share with different stakeholders
anti_patterns: Assuming the skill can connect to live databases and query data
Providing partial schema information and expecting complete diagrams
Using generated diagrams as the only database documentation

faq.question: Which database systems are supported?
faq.answer: Any database system. The skill works with schema definitions, not specific database engines.

faq.question: What input formats are accepted?
faq.answer: Prisma schemas, TypeORM entities, SQLAlchemy models, SQL dumps, and CREATE TABLE statements.

faq.question: Does this skill access my database?
faq.answer: No. You must provide the schema definition. The skill does not connect to any databases.

faq.question: Can I generate diagrams from multiple ORM formats together?
faq.answer: Yes. Combine multiple schema sources in your prompt for a unified diagram.

faq.question: What output formats are available?
faq.answer: Mermaid ERD, PlantUML, dbdiagram.io DBML, Markdown tables, and JSON schema.

faq.question: How does this compare toSchemaSpy or DBeaver?
faq.answer: This skill generates text-based diagrams through AI. Use SchemaSpy or DBeaver for automated database introspection.
